1906

24 January, 1970.

Ir. Sung Sing Kwan 
39 Peterboro St.

Boston, Mass.

My dear Kwan: |

Don's apologize.

I frequently get caught in the same compli -
cations which make necessary sudden and late changes of plans. We shall

got you out here yet; never fear.

I think you know perhaps better than I do the things that need

to be impressad on our good friend Tomy. Tell him to get down to business

anà remember that borhood days are over and it's time for him to show him -
gelt the man. jako clear to him also, in caso no more than his parents may 
bo to blame for the financial situation, that it is poor policy to carry a 
loan if he can noast bly avoid it; for the interest charges have to be met 
steadily, and in the end they stand, of course, as a doad loss.

I hope I shall 300 you un horo boforo February 10th, or perhaps 
botter noot you in Boston. I have been thinking of giving the Chinese boya 
here a littlo surprise at the time of the coming Chinese new year; and I was 
anxious to havo that surpruso take the form of some kind of a Chinesa meal 
at my house. In order to carry the thing out I have got to have some expert 
advice as to the character of the dishes and how they can be provided; and 
this advice I was hoping to get from you. If your examinations are over by 
the 5th, there will doubtless be time for me to get hold of you between that 
date and the 10th.

Wishing you every success on the exams, believe me as always

Faithfully yours,
